text: Quest 2 controllers
are not rechargeable directly,
but when a controller's battery runs low
you can replace the batteries
or use other rechargeable batteries.

You can tell when the
controller's battery is low

if you open your Oculus
app, go to devices,
and click on your controllers.
Each controller takes one AA battery.
When the battery runs low,

look for the arrow on
the top of the handle.
Slide the battery cover in this direction
to remove the cover, like this.

Remove the AA battery and
replace it with a fresh one.

Slide the cover back on until
it clicks firmly into place.
To avoid buying lots of AA batteries,
you could purchase rechargeable ones.

By keeping two batteries
fully charged on standby,
you can swap out the low-power batteries

and replace with the fully
charged ones whenever you need.

You can purchase the Anker
Charging Dock separately.

The Anker Charging Dock comes
with new controller covers
which utilize rechargeable batteries,
allowing you to recharge the controllers
and the headset at the same time
whenever they're plugged in to the dock.

A link for the dock is listed
in the description below.
